com.google.enterprise.connector.util.filter

Class AbstractDocumentFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.enterprise.connector.util.filter.AbstractDocumentFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DocumentFilterFactory
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AclPropertyFilter, AddPropertyFilter, CopyPropertyFilter, DeletePropertyFilter, ModifyPropertyFilter, SkipDocumentFilter

    public abstract class AbstractDocumentFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements DocumentFilterFactory
    A base Document filter implementation that does nothing. It is meant to used as a base class for document filter subclasses. Subclasses are exected to override findProperty(Document, String) and/or getPropertyNames(Document), but not newDocumentFilter(Document).
    Since:
    2.8

      • newDocumentFilter

        public Document newDocumentFilter(Document source)
                           throws RepositoryException
        Description copied from interface: DocumentFilterFactory
        Returns a new Document that acts as a filter for the supplied source Document.
        Specified by:
        newDocumentFilter in interface DocumentFilterFactory
        Parameters:
        source - the input Document for the filter - must not be null
        Returns:
        a document filter
        Throws:
        RepositoryException - if there was a problem accessing the source

      • findProperty

        public Property findProperty(Document source,
                    java.lang.String name)
                      throws RepositoryException
        Finds a Property by name. If the source Document has a property of that name, then that property is returned.

        Filter subclasses are likely to override this method.

        Parameters:
        source - the source Document for this filter
        name - the name of the property to find
        Returns:
        the Property, if found; null otherwise
        Throws:
        RepositoryException - if a repository access error occurs
        RepositoryDocumentException - if a document has fatal processing errors

      • getPropertyNames

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getPropertyNames(Document source)
                                                 throws RepositoryException
        Gets the set of names of all Properties in the source Document.

        Filter subclasses are likely to override this method.

        Parameters:
        source - the source Document for this filter
        Returns:
        the names, as a Set of Strings
        Throws:
        RepositoryException - if a repository access error occurs
        RepositoryDocumentException - if a document has fatal processing errors

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getPropertyValues

        public java.util.List<Value> getPropertyValues(Document source,
                                      java.lang.String name)
                                        throws RepositoryException
        Return a mutable list of all the existing Values of the named Property. Subclasses might make use of this convenience method.
        Parameters:
        source - the source Document for this filter
        name - the name of the Property whose values are to be fetched.
        Returns:
        a List of Values of the named property, or an empty list if the requested property does exist.
        Throws:
        RepositoryException - if a repository access error occurs
        RepositoryDocumentException - if a document has fatal processing errors
